intro: Gilia longituba subsp. eulongituba, commonly known as the longstem gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and showy, pink to purple flowers. The subspecies eulongituba is distinguished by its longer stems and more elongated corolla compared to the typical form. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant is an important nectar source for pollinators like bees and butterflies.
